resources.string: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The disease was first identified in December 2019 in Wuhan, the capital of China\'s Hubei province, and has since spread globally, resulting in the ongoing 2019â€“20 coronavirus pandemic. As of 26 April 2020, more than 2.92 million cases have been reported across 185 countries and territories, resulting in more than 203,000 deaths. More than 829,000 people have recovered.
